00034 // The base_integer class
00035 
00036 base_integer::~base_integer() {
00037     if (data && data->detach()) delete data;
00038 }
00039 
00040 detail::digit_t base_integer::_get_digit(size_t index) const {
00041     return data->digits[index];
00042 }
00043 
00044 detail::digit_t base_integer::_get_digit(size_t index, bool) const {
00045     if (index >= data->mLength) return 0;
00046     return data->digits[index];
00047 }
00048 
00049 size_t base_integer::_get_length() const {
00050     return data->mLength;
00051 }
00052 
00053 void base_integer::_attach(detail::data_t *new_data) {
00054     if (data && data->detach()) delete data;
00055     #ifdef XINT_DISABLE_COPY_ON_WRITE
00056         if (new_data==0 || new_data->mCopies==0) data=new_data;
00057         else {
00058             try {
00059                 data=new detail::data_t(new_data);
00060             } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
00061                 throw xint::overflow_error("Out of memory allocating xint::integer");
00062             }
00063         }
00064     #else
00065         data=new_data;
00066     #endif
00067     if (data) data->attach();
00068 }
00069 
00070 void base_integer::_attach(const base_integer& copy) {
00071     _attach(copy.data);
00072 }
00073 
00074 bool base_integer::_is_unique() const {
00075     return (!data || data->mCopies==1);
00076 }

00082 integer::integer() {
00083     _init();

00097 integer::integer(const integer& b) {
00098     _init(b);

00111 integer::integer(const blockable::integer& b) {
00112     if (b.is_nan()) throw xint::not_a_number();
00113     _attach(b);
00114 }

00136 integer::integer(const std::string& str, size_t base) {
00137     _init(from_string(str, base));

00140 void integer::_init(detail::digit_t init) {
00141     try {
00142         _attach(new detail::data_t(init));
00143     } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
00144         throw xint::overflow_error("Out of memory allocating xint::integer");
00145     }
00146 }
00147 
00148 void integer::_init(const integer &c) {
00149     _attach(c);
00150 }
00151 
00152 void integer::_init(boost::uintmax_t n) {
00153     try {
00154         _attach(new detail::data_t(n, true));
00155     } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
00156         throw xint::overflow_error("Out of memory allocating xint::integer");
00157     }
00158 }
00159 
00160 void integer::_make_unique() {
00161     try {
00162         if (!_is_unique()) _attach(new detail::data_t(_get_data()));
00163     } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
00164         throw xint::overflow_error("Out of memory allocating xint::integer");
00165     }
00166 }
00167 
00168 void integer::_set_negative(bool negative) {
00169     if (_get_data()->mIsNegative != negative) {
00170         _make_unique();
00171         detail::data_t *p=_get_data();
00172         p->mIsNegative=negative;
00173         p->skipLeadingZeros();
00174     }
00175 }
00176 
00181 bool integer::odd() const {
00182     return ((_get_digit(0) & 0x01)==1);
00183 }
00184 
00189 bool integer::even() const {
00190     return ((_get_digit(0) & 0x01)==0);
00191 }
00192 
00198 int integer::sign() const {
00199     if (_get_length()==1 && _get_digit(0)==0) return 0;
00200     else return (_get_data()->mIsNegative ? -1 : 1);
00201 }
00202 
00208 size_t integer::hex_digits() const {
00209     size_t bits=log2(*this);
00210     return (bits+3)/4; // Four bits per hex digit, rounded up
00211 }
00212 
00213 integer& integer::operator+=(const integer& addend) {
00214     if ((sign() < 0) == (addend.sign() < 0)
00215         && _get_length() >= addend._get_length())
00216     {
00217         // Fast in-place add
00218         _make_unique();
00219         _get_data()->add(addend._get_data());
00220     } else {
00221         // This works for all cases
00222         *this=add(*this, addend);
00223     }
00224     return *this;
00225 }
00226 
00227 integer& integer::operator-=(const integer& subtrahend) {
00228     if (sign() >= 0 && subtrahend.sign() >= 0 && *this >= subtrahend) {
00229         // Fast in-place subtract
00230         _make_unique();
00231         _get_data()->subtract(subtrahend._get_data());
00232     } else {
00233         // This works for all cases
00234         *this=subtract(*this, subtrahend);
00235     }
00236     return *this;
00237 }

00239 integer& integer::operator=(const integer &c) {
00240     _attach(c);
00241     return *this;
00242 }

00244 integer& integer::operator*=(const integer& b) { *this=multiply(*this, b); return *this; }
00245 integer& integer::operator/=(const integer& b) { *this=divide(*this, b); return *this; }
00246 integer& integer::operator%=(const integer& b) { *this=mod(*this, b); return *this; }
00247 
00248 integer& integer::operator++() { *this += one(); return *this; }
00249 integer& integer::operator--() { *this -= one(); return *this; }
00250 integer  integer::operator++(int) { integer s=*this; *this += one(); return s; }
00251 integer  integer::operator--(int) { integer s=*this; *this -= one(); return s; }

00253 integer  integer::operator<<(size_t shift) const { return shift_left(*this, shift); }
00254 integer  integer::operator>>(size_t shift) const { return shift_right(*this, shift); }
00255 integer& integer::operator&=(const integer& n) { *this=bitwise_and(*this, n); return *this; }
00256 integer& integer::operator|=(const integer& n) { *this=bitwise_or(*this, n); return *this; }
00257 integer& integer::operator^=(const integer& n) { *this=bitwise_xor(*this, n); return *this; }
00258 
00259 integer& integer::operator<<=(size_t shift) {
00260     if (shift>0) {
00261         _make_unique();
00262         _get_data()->shift_left(shift);
00263     }
00264     return *this;
00265 }
00266 
00267 integer& integer::operator>>=(size_t shift) {
00268     if (shift>0) {
00269         _make_unique();
00270         _get_data()->shift_right(shift);
00271     }
00272     return *this;
00273 }

00275 const integer& integer::zero() {
00276     if (cZero.get()==0) cZero.reset(new integer(0));
00277     return *cZero;
00278 }
00279 
00280 const integer& integer::one() {
00281     if (cOne.get()==0) cOne.reset(new integer(1));
00282     return *cOne;
00283 }
